member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.ExceptionFormatter.WriteException(System.Exception,System.Exception)
member.summary: Formats the exception and all nested inner exceptions.
member.param: The exception to format.
The outer exception. This value will be null when writing the outer-most exception.

remarks.para: This method calls itself recursively until it reaches an exception that does not have an inner exception.

This is a template method which calls the following methods in order
If the specified exception has an inner exception then it makes a recursive call.

member.summary: Formats an using reflection to get the information.
member.param: The to be formatted.

remarks.para: This method reflects over the public, instance properties and public, instance fields of the specified exception and prints them to the formatter. Certain property names are ignored because they are handled explicitly in other places.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.ExceptionManager.Process(System.Action,System.String)
member.summary: Executes the supplied delegate and handles any thrown exception according to the rules configured for .

The name of the policy to handle.
member.example:
The following code shows the usage of this method.
exceptionManager.Process(() => { DoWork(); }, "policy");

member.param: The policy name.
A set of objects.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.ExceptionPolicyImpl.HandleException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Checks if there is a policy entry that matches the type of the exception object specified by the parameter and if so, invokes the handlers associated with that entry.
member.param: The Exception to handle.
member.returns: Whether or not a rethrow is recommended.
member.remarks: The algorithm for matching the exception object to a set of handlers mimics that of a standard .NET exception policy. The specified exception object will be matched to a single exception policy entry by traversing its inheritance hierarchy. This means that if a FileNotFoundException, for example, is caught, but the only exception type that the exception policy knows how to handle is System.Exception, the event handlers for System.Exception will be invoked because FileNotFoundException ultimately derives from System.Exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.ExceptionPolicyImpl.GetPolicyEntry(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the policy entry associated with the specified key.
member.param: Type of the exception.
member.returns: The corresponding to this exception type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.ExceptionPolicyImpl.FindExceptionPolicyEntry(System.Type)
member.devDoc: Traverses the specified type's inheritance hierarchy

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.ExceptionPolicyImpl.PolicyName
member.summary: Name of this exception policy.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.IExceptionHandler
member.summary: Defines the contract for an ExceptionHandler. An ExceptionHandler contains specific handling logic (that is, logging the exception, replacing the exception, and so forth.) that is executed in a chain of multiple ExceptionHandlers. A chain of one or more ExceptionHandlers is executed based on the exception type being handled.

summary.para: When implemented by a class, handles an .

param.name: handlingInstanceId
param.para: The unique ID attached to the handling chain for this handling instance.

returns.para: Modified exception to pass to the next exceptionHandlerData in the chain.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.Instrumentation.IDefaultExceptionHandlingInstrumentationProvider
member.summary: Interface that defines the errors that can be reported when there's a fundamental problem with the Exception Handling Application Block.

member.summary: Fires the ExceptionHandlingErrorOccurred"/> event.
member.param: The name of the policy involved with the error.
The message that describes the failure.

member.summary: Interface defining the instrumentation events available from the Exception Handling Application Block.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.PolicyInjection.ExceptionCallHandler
member.summary: An that runs any exceptions returned from the target through the Exception Handling Application Block.
member.remarks: If the exception policy is configured to swallow exceptions, do not configure this call handler on a method with a non-void return value, as the handler doesn't know what value to return if the exception is swallowed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.PolicyInjection.ExceptionCallHandler.#ctor(Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.ExceptionPolicyImpl)
member.summary: Creates a new that processes exceptions using the given exception policy.
member.param: Exception policy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.PolicyInjection.ExceptionCallHandler.#ctor(Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.ExceptionPolicyImpl,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new that processes exceptions using the given exception policy.
member.param: Exception policy.
Order in which the handler will be executed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.PolicyInjection.ExceptionCallHandler.Invoke(Microsoft.Practices.Unity.InterceptionExtension.IMethodInvocation,Microsoft.Practices.Unity.InterceptionExtension.GetNextHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Processes the method call.
member.remarks: This handler does nothing before the call. If there is an exception returned, it runs the exception through the Exception Handling Application Block.
member.param: with information about the call.
delegate to call to get the next handler in the pipeline.
member.returns: Return value from the target, or the (possibly changed) exceptions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.PolicyInjection.ExceptionCallHandler.ExceptionPolicy
member.summary: Gets the exception policy used by this handler.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.PolicyInjection.ExceptionCallHandler.Order
member.summary: Gets or sets the order in which the handler will be executed

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.PolicyInjection.ExceptionCallHandlerAttribute
member.summary: An attribute used to apply the to the target.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.PolicyInjection.ExceptionCallHandlerAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new using the given exception policy name.
member.remarks: When using this attribute, the exception policy is always read from the default configuration.
member.param: Exception policy name from configuration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.PolicyInjection.ExceptionCallHandlerAttribute.CreateHandler(Microsoft.Practices.Unity.IUnityContainer)
member.summary: Derived classes implement this method. When called, it creates a new call handler as specified in the attribute configuration.
member.returns: A new call handler object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.PolicyInjection.ExceptionCallHandlerAttribute.PolicyName
member.summary: Get or sets the exception policy used by the handler.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.PostHandlingAction
member.summary: Determines what action should occur after an exception is handled by the configured exception handling chain.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.PostHandlingAction.None
member.summary: Indicates that no rethrow should occur.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.PostHandlingAction.NotifyRethrow
member.summary: Notify the caller that a rethrow is recommended.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.ExceptionHandling.PostHandlingAction.ThrowNewException
member.summary: Throws the exception after the exception has been handled by all handlers in the chain.
